<font color="a6aafb">Active</font>: Arlott cleaves in front of him, dealing 400<font color="fba51f"> (+80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to targets in the area while pushing them to the end of the AOE and briefly revealing their location (this skill can only be interrupted by Suppression).

120.name: Arlott
120.story: A demon human hybrid wielding two lances with a thirst for vengeance against both the Church and demons.

assist.desc: With her Ultimate, Ixia is capable of dealing impressive sustained damage. So she works best with heroes with area CC abilities, like Atlas and Vexana.

strong.desc: Ixia's skills make her a nice kiter. She works well against heroes with short ranges or poor Slow abilities, such as Fredrinn and Bane.

weak.desc: Ixia lacks survivability, that's why she can be countered by heroes with high burst damage or strong control abilities such as Saber and Aamon.

121.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/9ef19d373ea9fc1b8caa4398b5ca9927.png

skilllist.skilldesc:
Ixia's Basic Attacks and skills apply a stack of <font color="a6aafb">Starlium Charge</font> to enemies on hit. When Ixia performs a Basic Attack on an enemy with two stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Starlium Charge</font>, the attack will consume the stacks and be replaced with <font color="a6aafb">Siphon Starlium</font>, dealing <font color="fba51f"> (+150% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="26e407">(+200 Lifesteal)</font> plus (+10*Hero Level) <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to the target. Ixia recovers HP equal to the damage dealt by <font color="a6aafb">Siphon Starlium</font> (only 20<font color="26e407">(+150 Lifesteal)</font>% against non-hero units) and reduces the target's Movement Speed by 25% for 1s.
<font color="a6aafb">Siphon Starlium</font> can trigger on all enemies in front of Ixia that are within her Basic Attack range, but it cannot Crit.
Ixia's Basic Attacks cannot trigger Lifesteal.

Ixia fires 2 Starlium-charged energy beams along the ground in the target direction, dealing 75<font color="fba51f"> (+80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in a rectangular area. When hitting enemy heroes, Ixia gains 50% Movement Speed for 2s.
Enemies hit by both beams will take double damage.

Ixia unleashes a canister of Starlium energy in the target direction, knocking back nearby enemies, and pulling enemies in range to the center line after a short delay and dealing 200<font color="fba51f"> (+60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.

Ixia reassembles her weapon into 6 smaller weapons and enters the <font color="a6aafb">Barrage</font> state for 4s. In this state, Ixia's Basic Attacks and skills can hit enemies in the large fan-shaped area in front of her but not outside it. Ixia's Basic Attacks can hit up to 6 enemy units (prioritizes heroes), and <font color="a6aafb">Siphon Starlium</font> will fire simultaneously with her normal Basic Attacks.

121.name: Ixia
121.story: The leader of Bad Soul and self-proclaimed inventor, she wields a homemade weapon powered by a stolen Starlium reactor.

assist.desc: Nolan works well with Tanks that can initiate and CC the enemy so Nolan to focus on dealing as much damage as possible, such as Tigreal and Gatotkaca.

strong.desc: Nolan counters squishy heroes that lack mobility skills like Hanabi and Eudora because they have a hard time avoiding his rifts while Nolan's own mobility makes them easy targets.

weak.desc: Nolan is countered by tanky heroes with high sustained damage, such as Thamuz and Fredrinn, who can survive Nolan's burst and kill him afterwards.

122.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/cbbf269f46885175b8d3b5676daf24a6.png

skilllist.skilldesc:
Nolan's skills will leave a <font color="a6aafb">Rift</font>. When a rift comes into contact with another rift, they will <font color="a6aafb">activate</font> and pull enemies to their center and deal 240<font color="fba51f"> (+140% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> after a short delay. Each time a rift activation hits an enemy, Nolan will gain 20 Energy. If an enemy is hit by multiple rift activations, the damage after the first hit will be reduced by 40%.
<font color="a6aafb">Cosmic Leap</font>: If Nolan does not deal or take damage for 5s, he enhances his next Basic Attack to dash to the target, dealing <font color="fba51f"> (+120% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and leaving a <font color="a6aafb">Rift</font>. (Damage to and from Minions or Creeps will not prevent Nolan from getting this effect.)

Nolan cuts a rectangular area in front of him with his cosmic gauge, dealing 230<font color="fba51f"> (+40% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and leaving a <font color="a6aafb">Rift</font> at the first enemy hit.

Nolan charges in the target direction and slashes with his cosmic gauge, dealing 70<font color="fba51f"> (+13% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in his path and leaving a <font color="a6aafb">Rift</font>.

Nolan slashes at the target location 3 times, dealing 120<font color="fba51f"> (+50% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> with each slash while leaving 3 rifts and slowing the target hit by 30% for 0.5s. The rifts will be activated automatically while Nolan dashes backward.

122.name: Nolan
122.story: A scholar that wanders the universe with split souls to save his daughter.

assist.desc: Cici works well with heroes that have buffs and can boost survivability. Supports like Angela and Floryn can help Cici gain an early advantage by greatly amplifying her combat capabilities to end the game before it drags on too long.

strong.desc: Because of Cici's great kiting ability and her 1st Skill dealing Max HP damage, Cici counters certain Tanks like Fredrinn and Minotaur.

weak.desc: Cici is countered by heroes with targeted CC skills who can stop her dead in her tracks, such as Saber and Kaja.

123.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/c9d494c6996a58eb498eb50508310c04.png

skilllist.skilldesc: Cici generates a stack of Delight after dealing damage, increasing her Movement Speed by 0.75% and Spell Vamp by 0.75% per stack up to 10 times, doubling the effects at full stacks.

Cici uses Yoyo to continuously attack the nearest enemy within range (prioritizing heroes) for 3.5s, hitting them up to 10 times, and dealing <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> equal to 70 plus 3<font color="fba51f"> (+1.2% Extra Physical Attack)</font>% of the target's Max HP per hit. Cici can move and use other skills during this attack.

If there is no enemy within range, Yoyo will attack Turrets or the Base instead.

This skill deals 20% extra damage to Minions.

Cici leaps to a target location. If she lands on any unit (not including Turrets and Base), she can leap again in the Joystick's direction. If she lands on an enemy with the first leap, she deals 200<font color="fba51f"> (+40% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to them.

Cici throws Yoyo at the target enemy hero and links them with another nearby enemy hero, dealing 100<font color="fba51f"> (+10% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>, slowing them by 30%, and pulling them together for 4s. 

During this time, Cici can use <font color="a6aafb">Yo-Yo Blitz</font> to attack both linked targets at the same time. If only one target is within the range of <font color="a6aafb">Yo-Yo Blitz</font>, Cici will attack the target twice, but the damage of the second attack will be reduced to 25%.

123.name: Cici
123.story: A cheerful performer who spreads fun and wonderment wherever she goes.

assist.desc: Chip's Ultimate allows his team to group up from anywhere, so he works well with heroes who can't cross the map quickly but excel in teamfights, such as Alpha, Hanabi, and Kadita.

strong.desc: Chip possesses strong initiation and CC abilities, making him a great counter against heroes with low mobility or those who are relatively squishy, such as Vexana, Layla, and Ixia.

weak.desc: Since enemies can also use Chip's Connecting Portals, certain heroes with strong teamfighting abilities, like Barats and Tigreal, can use them to their advantage.

124.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/da414e182f118de13f1dedd94f483838.png

skilllist.skilldesc: Chip starts eating potato chips once every 2s when out of combat, regenerating HP equal to 300 plus 45% of lost HP after finishing a whole bag (requires 4 bites). After eating a bag of chips, Chip will be full and cannot eat again for 5s. (The bite count will be saved if he enters combat before finishing a whole bag.)

Chip rams his hovercraft into the ground, dealing <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> equal to 100 plus 4% of the target's Max HP and applying <font color="a6aafb">Chip's Mark</font> on enemy units hit. Chip gains a 300<font color="62f8fe"> (+60% Total Magic Power)</font> Shield upon hitting an enemy hero, which increases by 40% for each additional enemy hero hit. Chip's next Basic Attack will become ranged and also hit all nearby enemies with <font color="a6aafb">Chip's Mark</font>, detonating the mark to deal 150<font color="62f8fe"> (+30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and stun each target for 0.6s.

Chip rushes for 2s, gaining up to 65% extra Movement Speed, after which he maintains the max speed for 2s.

Chip's next Basic Attack will cause him to charge at the enemy, dealing 200<font color="62f8fe"> (+30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and knocking them back slightly.

Chip drops the <font color="a6aafb">Main Portal</font> on an enemy hero, dealing 200<font color="62f8fe"> (+60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and briefly slowing them by 25%. The Main Portal deals 2 times the damage and immobilizes them for 1s after a delay. Meanwhile, he creates <font color="a6aafb">Connecting Portals</font> near allied heroes 10 units away and behind the allied Base. The <font color="a6aafb">Main Portal</font> and <font color="a6aafb">Connecting Portals</font> last up to 15s.
<font color="a6aafb">Connecting Portal</font>: Heroes (on both teams) can teleport from <font color="a6aafb">Connecting Portals</font> to the <font color="a6aafb">Main Portal</font>, and allied heroes gain Burst Movement Speed for 1.5s and a 500 shield.
<font color="a6aafb">Main Portal</font>: The Main Portal inherits 70% of Chip's attributes. Heroes can stand on the <font color="a6aafb">Main Portal</font> for 2s to return to the <font color="a6aafb">Connecting Portal</font> they came from. Casting skills or launching Basic Attacks will reset the stand time.

Chip has 4 fixed <font color="a6aafb">Beacons</font> on the map when the battle starts. Use this skill to teleport to any other <font color="a6aafb">Beacon</font>. (This skill cannot be used in combat.)

124.name: Chip
124.story: A carefree, genetically enhanced fox that wields advanced portal technology.

assist.desc: Zhuxin can provide great damage and CC, but she can't realize her potential until later in the game, so heroes with CC can help Zhuxin get through the early period. Zhuxin also works well with sustained damage heroes like Belerick, Kimmy, and Cici to dish out a surprising amount of damage.

strong.desc: Zhuxin is a good counter to enemies with less range and low mobility, such as Popol and Kupa and Cyclops, where she has a big advantage.

weak.desc: Like most Mages, Zhuxin is countered by heroes with high mobility and burst, such as Fanny and Saber, who can quickly take her down.

125.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/dc19d6cdeb31fe8889d51a0c184a069a.jpg

skilllist.skilldesc:
Every time Zhuxin channels <font color="a6aafb">Lantern Flare</font>, she converts the Mana spent into up to 15 <font color="a6aafb">Crimson Butterflies</font> to follow her <font color="a6aafb">Spirit Lantern</font>. After Zhuxin stops channeling <font color="a6aafb">Lantern Flare</font>, the <font color="a6aafb">Crimson Butterflies</font> will gradually disappear, each restoring 5% of her Max Mana.
Zhuxin has a naturally high base Max Mana, but it doesn't scale with her level.

Zhuxin deals 150<font color="62f8fe"> (+30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> to all enemies in a fan-shaped area and applies 1 stack(s) of <font color="a6aafb">Soul Snare</font>. Zhuxin also slows all enemy heroes hit by 20% and gains 20% of extra Movement Speed herself for 1.5s.

<font color="a6aafb">Hold</font>: Zhuxin can move the <font color="a6aafb">Spirit Lantern</font> with the skill button, dealing 33<font color="62f8fe"> (+28% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> to all enemies within range every 0.25s (damage to Minions increased by 28%) and applying <font color="a6aafb">Soul Snare</font> to enemy heroes hit, each time consuming 120 Mana. When an enemy hero has 10 stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Soul Snare</font>, the <font color="a6aafb">Crimson Butterflies</font> will capture them, pulling them airborne for 1s.
<font color="a6aafb">Release</font>: Throws all captured enemies to the target location, dealing 300<font color="62f8fe"> (+150% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> to all enemies in the area. (If an enemy takes damage multiple times, subsequent damage taken will be reduced by 80%.)

Zhuxin blinks to the target location while gaining a 400<font color="62f8fe"> (+100% Total Magic Power)</font> shield. While flying, she creates a field around her for 6s. The field deals 60<font color="62f8fe"> (+20% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and applies 1 stack of <font color="a6aafb">Soul Snare</font> to enemies every 1s.

125.name: Zhuxin
125.story: A mysterious young woman who guides the ember butterflies using her Lantern of Spirits.

assist.desc: Heroes that provide control (like Tigreal) make it easier for Suyou to deal massive damage; heroes that provide recovery and extra movement speed (like Rafaela) help Suyou kite better.

strong.desc: Suyou's powerful long-range burst and pursuit abilities make it impossible for heroes without Blinks or Charges, such as Xavier and Ixia, to escape.

weak.desc: Because Suyou requires hold-casting skills, heroes with control can easily interrupt his attacks, such as Badang and Melissa.

126.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/1cce8eefc4b4c738e8aafafff6bafc84.png

skilllist.skilldesc:
<font color="a6aafb">Tap-casting</font> any skill will put Suyou in his Mortal form, granting him 40 Movement Speed and decreasing the interval between Basic Attacks.
<font color="a6aafb">Hold-casting</font> any skill will put Suyou in his Immortal form, increasing the damage of Basic Attacks to 125% and granting him 20% Physical Damage Reduction. In this form, for every 20 extra Physical Attack Suyou has, he gains 1% Physical Damage Reduction (up to 40%).

<font color="a6aafb">Tap</font>: Suyou throws his weapon in the target direction, dealing 250<font color="fba51f"> (+100% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in its path. Suyou then blinks to the weapon's location, catches it, and performs a slash in the opposite direction, dealing 375<font color="fba51f"> (+150% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.
<font color="a6aafb">Hold</font>: Suyou channels the Immortal's power and charges in the target direction, dealing 250<font color="fba51f"> (+100% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies along the path. When hitting an enemy hero, he stops and stuns enemies in a rectangular area in front for 0.6s. The charge distance increases with the hold time.
<font color="A4AAC7">Suyou can be controlled while charging, but the skill cannot be interrupted</font>.

<font color="a6aafb">Tap</font>: Suyou performs a sweeping attack with his weapon, dealing <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> equal to 300<font color="fba51f"> (+200% Extra Physical Attack)</font> plus 15% of target's Lost HP to enemies in a fan-shaped area.
<font color="a6aafb">Hold</font>: Suyou channels the power of the Immortal to perform 3 cleaves in a fan-shaped area. The first two strikes deal 250<font color="fba51f"> (+80% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> each, while the final strike deals 400<font color="fba51f"> (+128% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and recovers 150<font color="fba51f"> (+50% Extra Physical Attack)</font> HP for himself.

<font color="a6aafb">Tap</font>: Suyou glides backward and swings his weapon in the target direction, dealing 420<font color="fba51f"> (+120% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in a rectangular area and on his path backward, and reducing their Movement Speed by 30% for 1.5s.
<font color="a6aafb">Hold</font>: Suyou uses the Immortal's power to shoot a deadly arrow in the target direction, dealing 580<font color="fba51f"> (+165% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to the target hit. The range increases with the hold time. 
<font color="A4AAC7">Suyou can be controlled while charging, but the skill cannot be interrupted</font>.

126.name: Suyou
126.story: An exorcist from Zhu'an who has inherited the power of the Immortal Nuo.

assist.desc: Lukas's Sacred Beast form has extended attack range and enhanced mobility, which synergizes well with heroes possessing AOE CC, such as Atlas, Tigreal, and Gatotkaca.

strong.desc: Lukas excels in close-quarter combat and is a good counter to heroes with low mobility and CC, like Hanabi and Ixia.

weak.desc: Lukas needs to stay close to enemies to deal damage, which makes him vulnerable to heroes with strong burst and CC, such as Fanny, Valir, and Julian.

127.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/12a9a4f54f6f0e874a7ee51a84eda237.jpg

skilllist.skilldesc:
Lukas gains 0.5 Resolve per second and an additional 2 Resolve when attacking heroes.

Lukas consumes 10 Resolve per second while in [Sacred Beast] form.

<font color="a6aafb">Passive</font>: Basic Attacks enhance <font color="a6aafb">Flash Combo</font> up to 2 times, lasting 4s.
Lukas consumes all Vigor to unleash Pulverize, dealing 220<font color="fba51f"> (+120% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and recovering 8% of his Max HP when hitting a hero.
<font color="a6aafb">1 Stack</font>: Lukas briefly stuns the target and spins his tonfa hammers to deal 100<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> 3 times, pulling the enemy toward him.
<font color="a6aafb">2 Stacks</font>: Lukas briefly stuns the target and follows up with 2 attacks that deal 50<font color="fba51f"> (+20% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> per hit. He will then spin his tonfa hammers to deal 100<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> 3 times, gaining Control Immunity during this period.

Lukas dashes in the target direction and turns his next Basic Attack within 4s into <font color="a6aafb">Flash Strike</font>.
<font color="a6aafb">Flash Strike</font>: Lukas blinks behind the enemy, dealing 60<font color="fba51f"> (+125% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>. He then gains increased Attack Range, 20% Movement Speed and Attack Speed, and his Basic Attacks trigger lightning storms to deal 40<font color="fba51f"> (+25% Total Physical Attack)</font> extra <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>, lasting for 4s.

Lukas transforms into his <font color="a6aafb">Sacred Beast</font> form (briefly gains Control Immunity). His base Movement Speed is increased by 30, all attributes are increased by 15%, and his skills gain new effects.
<font color="a6aafb">Use Again</font>: Fires a Shockwave Blast in the target direction that will explode upon hitting an enemy hero or reaching its maximum range, dealing 450<font color="fba51f"> (+155% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.
<font color="A4AAC7">All attributes: HP, Physical Attack, Attack Speed, Physical & Magic Defense, and Attack Range.</font>

Lukas gains 0.5 Resolve per second and an additional 2 Resolve when attacking heroes.

Lukas consumes 10 Resolve per second while in [Sacred Beast] form.

<font color="a6aafb">Passive</font>: Basic Attacks enhance <font color="a6aafb">Flash Combo</font> up to 2 times, lasting 4s.
Lukas consumes all Vigor to unleash a tail swing, dealing 220<font color="fba51f"> (+120% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and recovers 8% of his Max HP when hitting a hero.
<font color="a6aafb">1 Stack</font>: Lukas briefly stuns the target and pounces to deal 100<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> 3 times, knocking the enemy back.
<font color="a6aafb">2 Stacks</font>: Lukas briefly stuns the target and leaps to deal 50<font color="fba51f"> (+20% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> 2 times, then summons sacred lightning, dealing 100<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> 3 times, and gaining Control Immunity during this period.

Lukas dashes in the target direction and turns his next Basic Attack within 4s into <font color="a6aafb">Lightning Clash</font>.

<font color="a6aafb">Lightning Clash</font>: Lukas charges toward the enemy, knocking them back and dealing 60<font color="fba51f"> (+125% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>. He then gains 20% Movement Speed and Attack Speed, and summons sacred lightning with Basic Attacks to deal 40<font color="fba51f"> (+25% Total Physical Attack)</font> extra <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>, lasting for 4s.

The Sacred Beast fires a Shockwave Blast in the target direction (gains Control Immunity during cast) that will explode upon hitting an enemy hero or reaching its maximum range, dealing 450<font color="fba51f"> (+155% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.

127.name: Lukas
127.story: A legendary Sacred Beast that can take the form of a rambunctious young man.

assist.desc: Kalea's strong single-target CC makes her work well with heroes who have high single-target burst, like Eudora, Harley, and Clint.

strong.desc: Kalea counters heroes who lack mobility like Layla and Chang'e.

weak.desc: However, Kalea cannot grab enemies with Control Immunity, so heroes like Diggie and Minotaur can effectively counter her.

128.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/f81399d64f2916499d853ca32c85902d.jpg

skilllist.skilldesc:
After casting a skill, Kalea creates a <font color="a6aafb">Water Zone</font> on the ground. When Kalea casts a skill within this zone, she will absorb the Water Zone to enhance her next three Basic Attacks with different effects:
First Basic Attack: Kalea dashes to the target, dealing <font color="fba51f"> (+100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.
Second Basic Attack: Kalea unleashes a flurry of attacks, dealing 200<font color="fba51f"> (+100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and recovering 40<font color="26e407"> (+10% Total HP)</font>  <font color="62f8fe">(+60% Total Magic Power)</font> HP for herself and the nearby ally with the lowest HP.
Third Basic Attack: Kalea uses her tail to strike the area around her target, dealing 100<font color="fba51f"> (+100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and creating a new <font color="a6aafb">Water Zone</font>. Enhanced Basic Attacks are not affected by Attack Speed.

Kalea slams her fist into the ground, creating a wave that deals 200<font color="26e407"> (+5% Total HP)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to nearby enemies and slows them by 40% for 1.5s.

Kalea charges forward and body slams the first enemy hero she encounters, knocking them airborne for 0.6s (unaffected by Resilience) while dealing 150<font color="fba51f"> (+60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>.
If she collides with an obstacle or touches the edge of a <font color="a6aafb">Water Zone</font> during her charge, Kalea will leap into the air. Cast the skill again to slam down at a target location, dealing 150<font color="fba51f"> (+60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and knocking enemies airborne for 0.6s (unaffected by Resilience).

Kalea grabs an enemy hero with her tail and slams them down in the Joystick's direction (drag the Joystick to change landing spot). She gains Control Immunity during this process. Upon landing, deals 300<font color="fba51f"> (+80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to the target and nearby enemies.

128.name: Kalea
128.story: With her serpent tail, this proud descendant of the Great Serpent swims gracefully through the Vonetis Sea, aspiring to one day carry the full power of her heritage.

assist.desc: While Zetian already has decent survivability, when paired with supports who can protect allies like Floryn and Rafaela, Fighters with limited range will struggle even more to approach Zetian. And with the healing from these supports, Zetian can win any ranged battle of attrition.

strong.desc: Zetian's Passive counters melee heroes with limited gap closers like Balmond and Zilong, allowing her to continue poking the enemy from a safe distance.

weak.desc: Zetian's Ultimate can strike down anywhere on the map, but having such a powerful Ult means a hero like Valentina can also use it against Zetian's team.

129.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/20a263b2adb23ad40cd955b9abf4bbb0.jpg

skilllist.skilldesc:
<font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Crown</font>: When Zetian hits enemy heroes with <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Strike</font> or <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Descent</font>, she gains 1% Spell Vamp for 5s, stacking up to 10 times.
<font color="a6aafb">Celestial Robe</font>: The power of the Phoenix periodically protects Zetian, knocking back and stunning any enemy hero who dares approach her while dealing 90(+10*Hero Level)<font color="62f8fe"> (+50% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> to them. She also gains a 300(+20*Hero Level)<font color="62f8fe"> (+50% Total Magic Power)</font> Shield that lasts 3s. This effect has a 120s cooldown.

Zetian unleashes a <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Wave</font> in the target direction. If it hits an enemy, she automatically casts another wave, up to 3 times. While casting, Zetian can use other skills.
The three <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Waves</font> deal 200<font color="62f8fe"> (+30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font>/200<font color="62f8fe"> (+30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font>/385<font color="62f8fe"> (+120% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font>, respectively. The third wave hits a larger area and pulls enemies toward the skill direction (not considered a control effect).
This skill only has 65% Spell Vamp efficiency against Minions.

Zetian summons a <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Spirit</font> at the target location, dealing 150<font color="62f8fe"> (+45% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and applying a brief 50% slow effect to enemies in the area. The <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Spirit</font> hovers at the location for 3s, dealing 20<font color="62f8fe"> (+10% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> every 0.5s and reducing enemies' Magic Defense by 10% while revealing their surrounding area.
While the <font color="a6aafb">Phoenix Spirit</font> is active, Zetian can use this skill again to command it to charge toward a designated location, dealing 150<font color="62f8fe"> (+45% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and applying a brief 50% slow effect upon arrival.

Zetian calls upon her divine mandate and the hearts of her people, granting all allied heroes 40% Movement Speed that gradually decays over 3s, while bringing divine retribution upon all enemy heroes, dealing 400<font color="62f8fe"> (+100% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color="7f62fe">Magic Damage</font> and stunning them for 0.8s. Zetian gains vision of all enemy heroes during this time.
Zetian can cast other skills while channeling this skill.

129.name: Zetian
129.story: Recognized by the Heavens and cherished by her people, the Celestial Empress of the Cadia Riverlands ascends to bring peace to the mortal realm.

assist.desc: Obsidia usually reaches her damage potential in the mid-to-late game, so she wants support heroes who can help her in the early game, like Angela and Estes.

strong.desc: Obsidia's Ultimate will disable dash and blink skills, making her excellent at countering heroes who rely on them,  such as Hayabusa, Freya, and Lancelot.

weak.desc: Obsidia struggles during the early laning phase, making her vulnerable to other Marksmen with strong early game, such as Bruno and Layla.

130.head: https://akmweb.youngjoygame.com/web/gms/image/ec1e6b75f6b975c30e30e40c2665d195.jpg

skilllist.skilldesc:
When Obsidia deals damage to enemies, she gains <font color="a6aafb">Bone Energy</font> (Basic Attacks against non-hero units grant 1 Energy, against hero units grant 2 Energy, and skills grant 3 times the Energy. No Energy is gained from hitting creeps). When <font color="a6aafb">Bone Energy</font> reaches 30, it forms a <font color="a6aafb">Bone Shard</font>, up to 25 shards. When Obsidia uses Basic Attacks, all <font color="a6aafb">Bone Shards</font> strike the target, each dealing <font color="fba51f"> (+7% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and inheriting 7% Attack Effects.
Killing an enemy hero directly grants 1 <font color="a6aafb">Bone Shard(s)</font>.
Obsidia's Basic Attacks deal 80<font color="fba51f"> (+70% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>, inheriting 70% Attack Effects.

Obsidia launches an <font color="a6aafb">Abyssal Bone Needle</font>, dealing 325<font color="fba51f"> (+80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies hit and triggering <font color="a6aafb">Return to Bone</font> on the first enemy hero struck.
Obsidia descends into the Abyss and enters <font color="a6aafb">Shadowmeld Form</font>, gaining 500% Movement Speed for 0.3s.

Obsidia shoots <font color="a6aafb">Bones of Wrath</font> in the target direction, dealing 125<font color="fba51f"> (+60% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> and briefly stunning the first enemy hero hit, and pulls herself near them. The <font color="a6aafb">Bones of Wrath</font> then tether to the enemy, preventing Obsidia from moving more than 4 units away from them. The enemy cannot use displacement skills, and their movement will pull Obsidia along. During this time, Obsidia gains 5 temporary <font color="a6aafb">Bone Shard(s)</font>. This effect lasts 3s.
During this time, Obsidia can move through obstacles and use Basic Attacks while moving. <font color="a6aafb">Phantom Shadowmeld</font> is enhanced, with its duration increased to 1s and cooldown reduced to 33%.

130.name: Obsidia
130.story: The ancient Sovereign of the Abyss, risen from ruin, now seeks to slay the God of Darkness and hunt down its Spawns of Decay.
